H0.text: Convection currents in the mantle cause the tectonic plates of Earth to continually move.

H1.text: Volcanic and seismic activity in the crust causes the tectonic plates of Earth to continually move.

H2.text: Strong winds and storms cause the tectonic plates of Earth to continually move.

H3.text: The rotation of the solid core causes the tectonic plates of Earth to continually move.

A4.text: Lateral density variations in the mantle result in convection currents, the slow creeping motion of Earth's solid mantle.
